title: Competency Enhancement Program for Evaluating Higher Education Instructional Design in Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theory and language education experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing Capabilities in Designing and Evaluating Blended Learning Environments for Current Practitioners to Apply in Workplace Settings

learning_goals: Apply the evaluation criteria for the five key elements of instructional design (objectives, content, activities, resources, assessment) in blended learning environments with 80% accuracy
Identify at least three instructional design flaws in language education curricula using VR simulations and propose improvement strategies

Learners analyze three or more corporate training programs using the Kirkpatrick Model's four-level evaluation scale (Level 1-4), measure satisfaction (≥80%), learning achievement (≥70%), behavior change (≥50%), and results metrics (ROI ≥120%) per level, and submit standardized reports

Learners design blended learning strategies supporting three or more device types (smartphones, tablets, laptops) in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) corporate environments, and develop implementation plans achieving learner engagement ≥80% and training satisfaction ≥4.0 (5-point scale)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
